subject: Re: assert returns void, i wish it didn't
msgSnippet: I was thinking the same thing...catching AssertionFailedError....but I don t think that is going to work.  As I look at this document...
messageBody:
I was thinking the same thing...catching AssertionFailedError....but I
don't think that is going to work. As I look at this document...

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookstour/cookstour.htm

I see that the asserts do throw exceptions ...but that exception is
already caught in the TestResult class in the framework. So if I wrap
the assert in my test case....I don't think I'll be catching that
exception. Who knows, maybe I can catch it....and then rethrow it? I
will try that.

Yes...reporting. I was trying to massage the results.xml Junit output
file with .xsl...and had some success...but not total success...I want
to try writing my own XML output as the tests run. Maybe this is a
bad idea...but the .xsl approach wasn't so good.

I was also reading JUnit Recipes, and I guess I could write my own
JUnit Results Formatter (Junit recipes, 7.6), but this might be biting
off more than I want to chew right now.

Thanks for the suggestion.

Mike




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Rutherford, Michael"
<michael.rutherford@...> wrote:
>
> If you really needed to you could probably catch AssertionFailedError ==
> false, no exception == true. Having said that what would you be doing,
> logging perhaps?
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Mike
> Foley
> Sent: Thursday, 5 October 2006 9:46 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] assert returns void, i wish it didn't
>
>
>
> Hi,
>
> So all the various assert methods all return void. How would I go
> about getting a boolean telling me the result of an assert? I need to
> do something with this information.
>
> Mike
>
>
>
>
>
>
